title: Adjective collection 4
sentences: My brother is very tall and plays basketball.
I am a bit short for my age.
Your dog is very fat because he eats a lot.
She is very thin since she does so much sport.
This sofa is very comfortable for taking a nap.
Esa silla de madera es muy
That wooden chair is very uncomfortable.
El centro de la ciudad es muy
The city center is very noisy because of the traffic.
Me gusta este parque porque es muy
I like this park because it is very silent.
It is dangerous to walk around here at night.
This neighborhood is very safe and quiet.
El examen de español fue muy
The Spanish exam was very easy for me.
Aprender a conducir es un poco
Learning to drive is a bit difficult at first.
That movie is very fun and I like it a lot.
El libro de historia es un poco
The history book is a bit boring.
This glass is made of thin/fine glass and breaks easily.
Wear a thick coat because it is going to snow.
El suelo de la cocina está muy
The kitchen floor is very slippery.
This food is spicy and I need to drink water.
El café sin azúcar es muy
Coffee without sugar is very bitter.
This dessert is too sweet for my taste.
El limón es una fruta muy
The lemon is a very acidic/sour fruit.
The soup is a bit salty; put less salt in it.
The food is a bit bland/tasteless; it needs more salt.
This knife doesn't cut; it is blunt/dull.
Ten cuidado, ese cristal está muy
Be careful; that glass is very sharp.
dictionary:
Alto - Tall
Bajo - Short
Gordo - Fat
Flaco - Thin
Cómodo - Comfortable
Incómodo - Uncomfortable
Ruidoso - Noisy
Silencioso - Silent
Peligroso - Dangerous
Seguro - Safe
Fácil - Easy
Difícil - Difficult
Divertido - Fun
Aburrido - Boring
Fino - Fine/Thin
Grueso - Thick
Resbaladizo - Slippery
Picante - Spicy
Amargo - Bitter
Dulce - Sweet
Ácido - Sour/Acidic
Salado - Salty
Soso - Bland/Tasteless
Desafilado - Blunt/Dull
Afilado - Sharp
